FYI @OpenSkywalking/pmc @OpenSkywalking/committer-team , this will be merged when the 3.3 iteration begins. So make sure this is good enough for you.

Great!
Java agent plugin management mechanism is very important for  flexible expansion and friendly use!
I think even  can configure what plugins I need when I'm packaged according maven. HAHA!
"The priority flow is env > properties > agent.config file" is good!
I think if read from env, maybe a json format parameter is enough instead of many parameters!
Thank you !

> I think if read from env, maybe a json format parameter is enough instead of many parameters!

@IluckySi Interesting point. Maybe after this is merged, you can send a pull request to implement your point. I will be glad to see that. The two ways from system env are my expected.
OK!

> Provide sharding jdbc as storage

Glad to know this from dangdang tech team. Hope this can be provided in Skywalking 3.3.x . If you need any help, you can call anyone from @OpenSkywalking/pmc and @hanahmily .
See #520 for codes.

Coverage increased (+0.05%) to 18.534% when pulling **71e68b3865a8511aa470f6e7b6aee303d519ebee on feature/plugin-feature** into **a21d117fecfafe4b72e462efb8481e9ced62a517 on master**.

The Skywalking targets Cloud Native Java Stack. So Spring Cloud and Microservice architecture, or other language agents. So ejb is not our primary goals.

**But, A Big BUT**, my design of Java agent should work in other middlewares, such as weblogic. If you have any problem, we can discuss that. And since we have supported SpringMVC and Struts, even don't have the Weblogic plugin, you application is able to be instrumented as well.

EJB is truely not supported yet. But if you are interested, it would be hard to develop a new plugin, and we welcome your contribution. I assume you are a Chinese, you can check the zh-doc for plugin development: https://github.com/OpenSkywalking/skywalking/wiki/Plugin-Development-Guide

Hope this helps you.
ok  thank you. i will try to use Skywalking  with SpringMVC  plugin .
